txt.en: You attempted to draw the sapling from its rooted location
You remained close to the sapling while coaxing it
Attempt to remove the sapling from the earth
Gently tug on the sapling and free the roots
You wandered too far and the sapling withered
Gently attempt to remove the sapling from the earth
Gently remove the sapling from the earth
Speak with Faranil at Glân Vraig
You attempted to extract the sapling
You attempted to extract the sapling
You attempt to remove the sapling from the earth, but the roots have burrowed deep into the soil, though you can feel that there is something in the sapling yearning to be free of the ground.
You attempted to extract the sapling
The sapling seems to have stopped moving
The sapling was killed
Try to remove the sapling from the ground
Try and remove the sapling from the ground, safely
You lost the sapling
You lost the sapling
You lost the sapling
Attempt to coax the sapling from its rooted spot
Stay close to the sapling
Do not wander too far away from the sapling
You lost the sapling
You tug gently on the sapling...
Your attempt to coax the sapling up from the ground failed. But, something tells you that there is still more to this sapling than meets the eye. Perhaps you should wait and see what happens next.
You attempted to extract the sapling, and it did not seem to recoil at the effort. There is definitely something different about this little sapling. It begins shaking and moving.

You gently tug on the sapling and the roots begin to pull free from the earth. Before you can completely and safely free the little sapling from the ground, it shakes. You are startled and let go.

Is the sapling looking at you? It has no eyes, this cannot be.

Is the sapling smiling at you? It has no mouth, this cannot be.

A feeling of kinship washes over you. There is something special here.
Find the source of the tremor Faranil felt
Wait and watch the sapling to see what happens
Do not let the sapling die
Collect and deliver the sapling to Faranil at Glân Vraig

The sapling moved while you watched. Fortunately no monsters happened by to fight you or the little sapling near your feet. As suddenly as it moved, the sapling then stopped. Perhaps you can attempt to dig it up again.
While wandering through the woods of the Ettenmoors you discovered a sapling shaking in the soil. Odd, that a little sapling would move while you drew near. You investigate.
You tried to uproot the sapling from its spot, but it did not move. Perhaps you need to try to dig it up again.

'Mae Govannen. I am Faranil, a tender of gardens and trees. You would rightly ask why one such as I would enlist to defend this accursed place, and I will tell you.

'After centuries in Rivendell, a tremor in the earth stirred my heart to action and drew me over the pass to this place. Lainedhal affords me a plot to study, learn, and seek what calls to my heart, but he cannot spare soldiers to defend me across these lands.

'I know that something awaits us beyond the gates of Glân Vraig, something wonderful and new, but I dare not make the journey.

'I wonder, friend, will you?

'I do not know what has awoken, but you will know when you see it.'
Deliver the sapling to the horticulturist at Glân Vraig
Attempt to coax the sapling from its rooted spot
The sapling seems prepared to free itself from the earth. One more good attempt should do. Try again.
Though you failed to remove the sapling, something feels different
Deliver the sapling to Faranil at Glân Vraig
Is the sapling smiling? Something is strange here
Carefully try to remove the sapling from the earth
This was unexpected. Try once more to collect the sapling. Faranil, in Glân Vraig, wants to study the trembling little sapling.
You deliver the sapling to Faranil
You deliver the sapling to Faranil
The sapling withers and dies...
You deliver the sapling to Faranil
Attempt to free the sapling one last time
Carry the sapling to Glân Vraig

'I wonder what this could mean. Surely there is healing happening in these lands. I think we shall need to investigate further. When you are prepared speak with me about this little gift. We shall embark on an adventure together, I think.'
Having delivered the sapling to Faranil, you should now speak with the horticulturist to see what she may know of this little sapling.
Though you failed to remove the sapling, something seems different
Is the sapling smiling? Something is strange here...
The sapling shakes in your hand, but does not budge. Is it laughing?
The sapling shakes in your hand but does not budge. Is it laughing?
The sapling seems to leap into your arms!
The sapling seems to leap into your arms!
The sapling seems to leap into your hands!
Attempt to remove the sapling from the earth
The sapling remains rooted in the earth
Gently tug on the sapling to potentially free its roots
A Sapling Grows in the Ettenmoors
Though the sapling did not move it seems to be ready for something
You deliver the sapling to Faranil
The sapling seems to have moved upward
You ventured too far away and the sapling withered
Search the Ettenmoors for the tremor that stirred the earth, collect it and return it to Faranil at Glân Vraig.
Though not free, the sapling is now ready

Carrying the sapling

You are unsure what it might take to remove the little sapling from the ground. It is clear that the sapling wants to be free, and that it seems to like you. Is such a thing even possible? Wait and see what the sapling does.

You gently tug on the sapling and the roots begin to pull free from the earth. Before you can completely and safely free the little sapling from the ground, it shakes. You are startled and let go.

Is the sapling looking at you? It has no eyes, this cannot be.

Is the sapling smiling at you? It has no mouth, this cannot be.

A feeling of kinship washes over you. There is something special here.
